result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Glover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Robert L Glover was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert L Glover is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Robert L Glover was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Robert L Glover was found guilty of Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision on Count 3

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 472 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No Contact with Victim A. No Contact with a child under the age of 6 until the Agent deems it appropriate.
Attend Anger Management and Parenting Classes.
  Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes a motion to STAY the sentence.
Court denies the motion.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
6 MONTHS JAIL
Sentence is to run Consecutive to Count 3.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision under Count 3.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.  



COUNT 3
Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  7 YEARS and 6 MONTHS
Initial Confinement:  4 YEARS and 6 MONTHS
Extended Supervision:  3 YEARS
472-Days Credit.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent

No contact with a child under the age of 6 until the Agent deems it appropriate

Case called at 8:34 AM 
Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert L Glover in court, in custody, with attorney Pablo Galaviz.  
Defendant Dale B. Bradby Jr, in court, in custody, with attorney Tyler Jochman
Attorney Galaviz filed a Motion for a Mistrial.
Attorney Galaviz presents arguments. State presents arguments.
Court denies the motion.
Attorney Galaviz indicates that Mr. Glover has decided not to testify.
Court conducts colloquy with Robert G. Glover.
Jurors enter the courtroom at 9:10 a.m.  Attorney Galaviz rests.
Attorney Jochman calls Dale B. Bradby Jr. sworn and testified.
Direct-examination by Attorney Jochman.
Cross-examination by the State.  Jurors are excused at 9:44 a.m.
Court addresses the Jury Instructions with the Attorneys.
Attorney Jochman rests.  Testimony is closed.
Jurors enter the courtroom at 10:07 a.m.  Court reads the Jury Instructions to the Jury.
State presents Closing Arguments.   Attorney Galaviz presents Closing Arguments.
Attorney Jochman presents Closing Arguments.  State presents Rebuttal Closing Arguments.
Court gives the final Jury Instruction to the jurors.
Clerk swears in the Civilian Bailiff in charge of the Jurors.
Court selects the alternate juror, J.B.  Jurors go to deliberate at 12:13 p.m.

Court reconvenes at 1:20 p.m.  Jury had a question at 12:50 p.m.
Same appearances.  Court plays the photos in Exhibit 1 to the Jury.
Jury goes back to deliberation.  Court reconvenes at 2:30 p.m. to address a question from the jury.
Jury goes back to deliberation.  Jury reached a verdict at 2:54 p.m.
State vs. Dale B. Bradby Jr. - 22CF0080 - Jury found the defendant Not Guilty.
State vs. Robert L. Glover - 22CF0079 - Jury found the defendant Not Guilty on Count 1.
Jury found the defendant Guilty on Counts 2 and 3.
State motion for Judgment on Robert Glover 22CF0079 Counts 2 and 3.
Attorney Galaviz makes a motion to dismiss.
Court will enter an Acquittal for Dale B. Bradby - 22CF0080.
Court will withhold entry of Judgment for Ct. 2 for Robert L. Glover.
Court will enter Judgment for Ct. 3 for Robert L. Glover.
Court will revoke bail on Robert L. Glover and he is remanded into custody.
Court sets a plea/sentencing date for Robert L. Glover on 5-9-2022 at 11:15 a.m.
Motion to Grant a Mistrial;  filed by Atty. Pablo Galaviz

Case called at 8:25 AM for Day 2 of Trial.
Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Detective Kenneth Stucker.
Defendant Robert L Glover in court, in custody, with attorney Pablo Galaviz.  
Defendant Dale B. Bradby Jr. in court, in custody, with attorney Tyler Jochman.
Court has a discussion with the attorneys.
Jurors enter the courtroom at 8:34 a.m.
Detective Kenneth Stucker retakes the witness stand previously sworn to testify.
Direct-examination by the State continues.
Exhibits 4 and 5 marked.  Exhibit 4 offered and received.
Exhibit 5 offered and received.  Cross-examination by Attorney Galaviz.
Court takes a recess at 9:31 a.m.  Jurors are excused.
Court reconvenes at 9:44 a.m.  Same appearances.  Jurors enter courtroom at 9:45 a.m.
Cross-examination by Attorney Galaviz continues.  Jurors are excused at 10:07 a.m.
Court has a discussion with the Attorneys.  Jurors enter the courtroom at 10:17 a.m.
Cross-examination by Attorney Galaviz continues.  Cross-examination by Attorney Jochman.
State calls Dr. Hillary Petska sworn and testified.  Exhibits 6 and 7 marked.
Exhibit 6 offered and received.  Exhibit 7 offered and received.
Cross-examination by Attorney Galaviz.  Court breaks for lunch at 12:12 p.m.
Jurors are excused.

Court reconvenes at 1:07 p.m.  Same appearances.  Court addresses the attorneys.
Jurors enter the courtroom at 1:18 p.m.  Detective Kenneth Stucker retakes the witness stand.
Re-direct examination by the State.  Exhibits 8, 9, 10, and 11 marked.
Jurors excused at 1:34 p.m.  Jurors return to the courtroom at 1:37 p.m.
Exhibit 8, 9, and 10 offered and received.  Re-cross by Attorney Galaviz.
Re-cross by Attorney Jochman.  State rests.  Jurors are excused at 2:04 p.m.
Attorney Galaviz makes a motion to dismiss the charges against Robert Glover.
Court denies the motion. 
Attorney Jochman makes a motion to dismiss the charge against Dale Bradby.
Court denies the motion.  Jurors enter the courtroom at 2:18 p.m.
Attorney Galaviz calls Jasmine McGee sworn and testified.
Direct-examination by Attorney Pablo Galaviz.  No questions by Attorney Jochman.
Cross-examination by the State.  Exhibit 12 marked, offered, and received.  
Re-direct by Attorney Galaviz.  Attorney Galaviz calls Melisha J. Thompson sworn and testified.
Direct-examination by Attorney Galaviz.  Court takes a break at 3:33 p.m.
Jurors are excused.  Court reconvenes at 3:48 p.m.  Same appearances.
Jurors enter the courtroom at 3:52 p.m.  Direct-examination by Attorney Galaviz continues.
Direct-examination by Attorney Jochman.  Cross-examination by the State.
Exhibit 13 marked, offered, and received.  Re-direct by Attorney Galaviz.
Jurors are excused at 4:51 p.m.  Court addresses the attorneys.  
Attorney Galaviz makes a motion for a MisTrial and presents arguments.
State presents arguments.  Court will deny the motion.  Court will invite the parties to provide case law tomorrow.
The Court will reconsider the motion for a MisTrial tomorrow.
Jurors enter the courtroom at 5:09 p.m.  Attorney Jochman calls Yolanda Collins sworn and testified.
Direct-examination by Attorney Jochman.  Cross-examination by the State.
Court excuses the Jurors for the day at 5:15 p.m.  Court takes a recess so the Attorneys can discuss with their 
defendant if they will be testifying.  Court is in recess at 5:20 p.m.
Court reconvenes at 5:37 p.m.  Same appearances.
Attorney Galaviz indicates that his client wishes to testify.  Court has colloquy with Robert Glover.
Attorney Jochman indicates that his client wishes to testify.  Court has colloquy with Dale Bradby.
Court will conclude for the day at 5:45 p.m.

State's exhibits 1 and 2 marked.  Direct-examination by the State continues.
State's exhibits 1 and 2 offered and received.  Cross-examination by Attorney Galaviz.
Cross-examination by Attorney Jochman.  Re-direct by the State.  Re-cross by Attorney Galaviz.
Re-cross by Attorney Jochman.  Court takes a recess at 4:03 p.m.  Jurors are excused.
Court reconvenes at 4:14 p.m.  Jurors enter the courtroom.
State calls Officer Shemia Watts sworn and testified.  Direct-examination by the State.
Cross-examination by Attorney Galaviz.  Cross-examination by Attorney Jochman.
Re-direct by the State.  Re-Cross by Attorney Jochman.
State calls Detective Stucker sworn and testified.  Direct-examination by the State.
State's exhibit 3 marked, offered, and received.  Exhibit 3 (parts of it) played to the jury.
Court excuses the jurors for the day at 5:13 p.m.  Court gives the jurors exit instructions for the day.
Court has a discusion with the attorneys.  Court concludes for the day at 5:20 p.m.

Case called at 3:19 PM for a preliminary hearing.
Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert L Glover in court, in custody, with attorney Pablo Galaviz. 
State calls Detective Kenneth Stucker sworn and testified.
Direct-examination by the State.  
Cross-examinaton by Attorney Galaviz.  Re-direct by the State.
State rests.  Defense has no witnesses to present.
State moves for bind over.  Defense objects to bind over.
Defense requests that that the case be dismissed.
Upon review of the testimony and for reasons as placed on the record, the Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and that the defendant probably committed the felony.
The court binds the defendant over for trial. 
Information filed.    Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Attorney Galaviz requests that bail be modified.
State objects.  Court denies the motion.

Case called at 1:41 PM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert L Glover in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy Perri as friend of the Court.    
Attorney Perri indicates that their office is trying to find counsel for the defendant.
Attorney Galaviz also appears in court to address the court and is willing to take this case.
Attorney Perri will appoint Attorney Galaviz promptly.
Court is tolling the prelim for good cause.
Court will schedule the case for a preliminary hearing in this court next week. Defendant Robert L Glover in court, in custody, with attorney Pablo Galaviz.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on January 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:50 PM Defendant Robert L Glover in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy Christian Perri.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Perri states they are actively working to appoint counsel in this case and they are working to find a private bar attorney.  The Court conducts colloquy with the defendant in regards to counsel and finds the defendant does want an attorney to represent him.  The Court will continue to toll the time limits for the preliminary hearing and sets this matter before the Trial Court this week to address the issue of counsel.  This Court will leave it in the discretion of Judge Melvin whether to continue to toll the time limits or to appoint counsel.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on January 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

The Court admonishs the SPD.  
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on January 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Attorney Herbers states the SPD has contacted 20 attorney to take the case, however no success.
The Court orders the SPD to file a report as to reaching out to attorneys. 
The Court will bring the matter back quickly.

Hearing on January 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A/Victim B, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A/Victim B listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

01:42 PM Defendant Robert L Glover in court, in custody, with attorney Priya Barnes.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Barnes appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Attorney Barnes notes that the defendant was previously represented by Attorney Robert Penegor.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
